text: What a person's mind can comprehend and what he can believe, he is able to achieve
author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

text: Strive not for success, but for the values it gives
author: Albert Einstein

text: I owe my success to the fact that I have never made excuses or accepted excuses from others
author: Florence Nightingale

text: During my career, I missed more than 9,000 shots, lost almost 300 games
author: Michael Jordan

text: The hardest thing is to start acting, everything else depends only on perseverance
author: Amelia Earhart

text: One must love life more than the meaning of life
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: Life is what happens to you while you're making plans
author: John Lennon

text: Logic can lead you from point A to point B, and imagination - anywhere
author: Albert Einstein

text: In 20 years you will be more disappointed with the things you didn't do than the ones you did
author: Mark Twain

text: It's always worth starting with something that sows doubts
author: Boris Strugatsky

text: Real responsibility is only personal
author: Fazil Iskander

text: An unintelligent life is not worth living
author: Socrates

text: 80% of success is to appear in the right place at the right time
author: Woody Allen

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life
author: Steve Jobs

text: Victory is not everything, everything is a constant desire to win
author: Vince Lombardi, American football coach

text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life
author: Immanuel Kant

text: There is no word 'impossible' in my dictionary
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Freedom is worthless if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Either you control your day, or the day controls you
author: Jim Ron, speaker and business coach

text: If you think you're capable of something, you're right; if you think you won't succeed, you're right too
author: Henry Ford

text: The two most important days in your life: the day you were born and the day you realized why
author: Mark Twain

text: Start doing everything you can do – and even what you can at least dream of
author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

text: The best revenge is a huge success
author: Frank Sinatra

text: It is often said that motivation does not last long
author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman and marketing consultant

text: Weak people try to be no worse than others all their lives
author: Boris Akunin

text: It's all about thoughts
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing and be nobody
author: Aristotle

text: The person you are destined to become is only the person you decide to become
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet and philosopher

text: Walk confidently towards the dream
author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, naturalist

text: I hope that at the end of my days, when I stand before God, I will not have a drop of talent left so that I can say to him I used everything that you gave me
author: Erma Bombek, writer, journalist

text: It's better to be sure of a good result than to hope for an excellent one
author: Warren Buffett

text: Some things can capture your attention, but focus better on those that capture your heart
author: Indian proverb

text: One has only to believe that you can – and you are already halfway to the goal
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don't blame a child for being afraid of the dark
author: Plato

text: Learn to speak “I do not know”, and this will already be progress
author: Moses Maimonides, Jewish philosopher and theologian

text: Start from where you are now
author: Arthur Ashe, tennis player

text: When I was 5 years old, my mother always said that the main thing in life is happiness
author: John Lennon

text: Fall seven times and rise eight times
author: Japanese saying

text: When one door closes fortunately, another opens immediately
author: Helen Keller, writer, lecturer, political activist

text: Everything has its own beauty, but not everyone can see it
author: Confucius

text: How wonderful that you don't have to wait a minute to start making the world a better place
author: Anne Frank

text: When I get rid of who I am, I become who I can be
author: Lao Tzu

text: Happiness is not something ready-made
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you are offered a place in a rocket carrier, do not ask what kind of place! Just take it
author: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook COO

text: First decide on your ideal: set a goal
author: Aristotle

text: If there is no wind, take the oars
author: Latin proverb

text: Always rely on the idea that your own decision to succeed is much more important than anything else
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Success is the ability to go from defeat to defeat without losing optimism
author: Winston Churchill

text: They ask: 'How can you manage all the cases in fifteen minutes?' I answer: 'It's simple'
author: Richard Branson, British entrepreneur, founder of Virgin Corporation

text: Everyone wants to change humanity, but no one thinks about how to change themselves
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It is important to believe that talent is given to us for a reason – and that at any cost it must be used for something
author: Marie Curie

text: If an inner voice tells you that you can't draw - draw as much as possible, then this voice will subside
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Goal certainty is the starting point of all achievements
author: William Clement Stone, writer and businessman

text: We become what we think about
author: Earl Nightingale, radio host

text: I am not a victim of circumstances, I am the result of my decisions
author: Stephen Covey, consultant and lecturer in organizational management

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago
author: Chinese proverb

text: All children are artists
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I was struck by how important it is to take action
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: What is money? A person is successful if he wakes up in the morning, returns to bed in the evening, and does what he likes during the break
author: Bob Dylan

text: I didn't fail the test
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Defeat is not defeat unless you recognize it as such in your mind
author: Bruce Lee

text: Failure is just an opportunity to start again, but more wisely
author: Henry Ford

text: I'm sure: you can't let the wretched word 'you can't' stop you
author: Richard Branson

text: Only the one who doesn't try anything new never makes mistakes
author: Albert Einstein

text: You become what you believe in
author: Oprah Winfrey, TV presenter

text: Happiness is not in always doing what you want, but in always wanting what you do
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: I'd rather die of passion than of boredom
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: You learn the fastest in three cases - before the age of 7, at trainings, and when life has driven you into a corner
author: Stephen Covey

text: People will forget what you said will forget what you did, but will never forget what you made them feel
author: Maya Angelou, writer and poet

text: Our consciousness is everything
author: Buddha

text: If you want to build a ship, you don't need to call people, plan, share work, get tools
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Never think that you already know everything
author: Ivan Pavlov, a scientist-physiologist

text: It's not as important how slowly you walk as how long you walk without stopping
author: Confucius

text: If you think about what you have in life, you can always have more
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Turn your large-scale thoughts into large-scale actions as quickly as possible
author: Donald Trump

text: To lead people, follow them
author: Lao Tzu

text: Remember that not achieving success is sometimes also a great success
author: Dalai Lama

text: Always choose the most difficult path - you will not meet competitors on it
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: One completed productive task is worth fifty half-completed tasks
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Our life begins to come to an end when we stop talking about really important things
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Trouble does not come alone, but luck too
author: Romain Rolland, writer

text: Every thought is like a test, it's worth mashing it well — you can make everything out of it
author: Ivan Turgenev

text: Do everything you can, wherever you are, using everything you have
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The world is divided into two classes - some believe in the incredible, others do the impossible
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only happiness in life is a constant striving forward
author: Emile Zola

text: Not the strongest survives, but the most susceptible to change
author: Charles Darwin

text: You can say that you have bad genetics, bad metabolism, and you can just raise your ass off the couch and start working on yourself, set a goal and believe in yourself
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Never falling is not the greatest merit in life
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The question is not who will allow me, but who will be able to forbid me
author: Ayn Rand

text: When it seems that the whole world is against you, remember that the plane takes off not in the wind, but against it
author: Henry Ford

text: Life is measured not by how many years there are in it, but by how many years of real life there are in these years
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: To benefit the world is the only way to become happy
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Either write something worthwhile or do something worth writing about
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The only way to do something very well is to love what you do
author: Steve Jobs

text: A wise man demands everything only from himself, an insignificant man demands everything from others
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Great are those who see that thoughts rule the world
author: Ralph Emerson

text: Before climbing the ladder of success, make sure that it is leaning against the wall of the building that you need
author: Stephen Covey

text: At the origins of every successful enterprise is a bold decision once made
author: Peter Drucker, American economist
